gov.nasa.ial.mde.solver.symbolic
Class Polynomial

java.lang.Object
  gov.nasa.ial.mde.solver.symbolic.Polynomial

public class Polynomial
extends Object

Class to handle polynomial expressions Handles some algebraic simplification by polynomial multiplication and consolidation of like terms.

Since:
1.0
Version:
1.0
Author:
Dr. Robert Shelton

          Special string to indicate no variables i.e. all exponents = 0 use as a signature key (see below) in place of the empty string which would result if there were no variables

Field Detail

CONSTANT

public static final String CONSTANT
Special string to indicate no variables i.e. all exponents = 0 use as a signature key (see below) in place of the empty string which would result if there were no variables

Returns:

asAPolynomialIn

public Polynomial asAPolynomialIn(String[] vars)
Constructs the Polynomial equivalent to this Polynomial expressed as a Polynomial in the given variables. The coefficients of the constructed Polynomial are Expressions which contain all dependences on other variables The implementation calls this.toExpression and a Polynomial constructor, thus efficiency could be an issue

Parameters:
vars - an array of String representations of the polynomial variables of the constructed Polynomial
Returns:
the Polynomial in the specified variables.

oneVariablePolynomial

public Polynomial oneVariablePolynomial(String theVariable)
One-variable case of asAPolynomial.

Parameters:
theVariable - String representation of the desired polynomial variable
Returns:
the one-variable equivalent of this Polynomial

getCoefficientsAsExpressions

public Expression[] getCoefficientsAsExpressions(String var)
Extracts coefficients of the one-variable equivalent of this Polynomial as an array of Expressions Caches the resulting Expression array, thus repetitive calls require little overhead

Parameters:
var - String representation of the variable in which we want the polynomial described by the coefficients to be written
Returns:
an array of Expressions of this Polynomial considered as a polynomial in the variable var. If d is the degree of this Polynomial in var, then this Polynomial is equivalent to e[0]*(var)^d + e[1]*(var)^(d-1) + ... + e[d].

getCoefficientsAsExpressions

public static Expression[] getCoefficientsAsExpressions(Polynomial p,
                                                        String var)
Constructs an array of Expressions representing coefficients from all terms of a Polynomial p that are pure powers of the variable var. Note that when p contains other variables, one can obtain unexpected results. Normally you should call the corresponding instance method to retrieve coefficients of a Polynomial in more than one variable.

Parameters:
p - the Polynomial
var - the String representation of the variable
Returns:
the coefficients as an array of Expressions

Parameters:
ce - the expression to evaluate.
cd - the coefficients from the evaluation.

hasConstantCoefficients

public boolean hasConstantCoefficients()
Determines if all coefficients including the "constant" term are numerical constants This Polynomial will be constant iff each coefficient has an empty variables list
